edu.umaryland.igs.idea
Class TextFieldInputVerifier

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.InputVerifier
      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.TextFieldInputVerifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
StateDependentInputVerifier
public abstract class TextFieldInputVerifier
extends InputVerifier
implements Cloneable, Serializable

TextFieldInputVerifier is a convenience extension of InputVerifier that passes calls to verify through to its own verifyText method, which subclasses define. This is the base classe for all IDEA input validators that validate parameters' text fields. All cloning-related code in these classes is not currently supported.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2007, Amy Egan and Joana C. Silva.

All rights reserved.

Author:
Amy Egan

verify

public boolean verify(JComponent input)
The verify method is declared by InputVerifier. TextFieldInputVerifier's implementation obtains the text field's String contents and calls verifyText on those contents. This allows subclasses to deal directly with strings. Adding any input verifier to a parameter actually adds a substitute input verifier that automatically fails any JComponent that is not a JTextField, so this class can assume that the supplied component is a text field.

Specified by:
verify in class InputVerifier
Parameters:
input - the component to validate; always a JTextField
Returns:
whether the text field's text is valid according to a subclass

shouldYieldFocus

public boolean shouldYieldFocus(JComponent input)
The shouldYieldFocus method is declared by InputVerifier. TextFieldInputVerifier's implementation displays an error dialog if input is invalid.

Overrides:
shouldYieldFocus in class InputVerifier
Parameters:
input - the component to validate; always a JTextField
Returns:
whether the text field's text is valid according to a subclass

verifyText

public abstract boolean verifyText(String text)
The verifyText method should return whether the text meets a particular input verifier's requirements.

Parameters:
text - the text to validate
Returns:
whether the text is valid

errorMessage

abstract String errorMessage(String text)
The errorMessage method should return a descriptive explanation of the reason for an entry's failure. Subclass implementations should not call verifyText but may return error messages saved during an earlier call to verifyText.

Parameters:
text - the text which was found to be invalid during a previous validation attempt
Returns:
a descriptive error message explaining why the entry is invalid

warn

void warn(String inputText)
The warn method shows an error dialog with the subclass-defined error message.

Parameters:
inputText - the text which was found to be invalid during a previous validation attempt
